macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Indian Markets Open Lower; Nifty Eyes 26,000 Breakout
items.summary: The Nifty 50 opened down 0.18% at 25,906.70 and Sensex declined 0.31% at 83,968.43. Analysts expect consolidation around the 26,000 psychological level with a positive bias, with potential upside toward 26,200-26,300 if this level holds.

items.title: Sectoral Mixed Performance in Indian Markets
items.summary: Nifty Auto led gains with a 1.3% increase, while Nifty Pharma and PSU indices advanced around 1% each. However, Nifty IT declined 1.8% and Nifty Private Bank slipped 0.2%.

items.title: Bank Nifty Shows Consolidation with Positive Undertone
items.summary: Bank Nifty formed a bullish hammer-like candle pattern, with PSU banking stocks outperforming private sector counterparts. A move above Monday's high of 60,876 could lead to further upside toward 61,200-61,800 levels.

items.title: U.S. Markets Mixed on Better-Than-Expected Jobs Report
items.summary: The Dow Jones traded in red while S&P 500 and Nasdaq traded higher following a better-than-expected delayed January jobs report.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Coinbase Launches AI-Powered Agent Wallets
items.summary: Coinbase has introduced 'Agentic Wallets,' enabling AI agents to independently hold funds, make payments, execute trades, and generate interest on EVM chains and Solana using the x402 protocol.

items.title: Bitcoin Surpasses 68,000 USDT Amid Narrowed 24-Hour Decline
items.summary: Bitcoin crossed the 68,000 USDT mark, trading at 68,046 USDT with a 1.36% decrease over the past 24 hours, signaling a potential stabilization after recent market pullback.

items.title: JPMorgan Bullish on Crypto Recovery in 2026 Despite Crash
items.summary: JPMorgan analysts predict institutional inflows and regulatory clarity will drive a crypto rally in 2026, noting Bitcoin's production cost at around $77,000 while it trades near $66,000-$68,000.

items.title: Zerohash Adds Support for Monad Blockchain and USDC
items.summary: Crypto infrastructure firm Zerohash integrated Monad blockchain and USDC support, allowing clients like Kalshi, Gusto, and Public to launch stablecoin payments without managing blockchain infrastructure.

items.title: Barry Silbert Predicts Bitcoin Flow to Privacy-Focused Assets
items.summary: DCG founder Barry Silbert stated that 5% to 10% of Bitcoin may shift to privacy-oriented crypto assets in the future.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: WildCat: New Technique Solves AI Attention Mechanism Efficiency Problem
items.summary: Scientists from Imperial College London and Microsoft Research have unveiled WildCat, a novel compression technique for neural network attention mechanisms that achieves near-linear computational scaling instead of quadratic scaling, delivering higher-quality outputs more quickly than existing methods while reducing memory requirements for language models.

items.title: MIT Researcher Highlights AI Inflection Point for Scientific Discovery
items.summary: Rafael Gómez-Bombarelli at MIT discusses how combining physics-based simulations with machine learning and generative AI is accelerating material discovery, noting that AI for simulations has evolved from experimental concept to consensus scientific view with major tech companies now conducting similar research.

items.title: ET Enterprise AI Agentic Summit 2026 Launches in Mumbai
items.summary: India's enterprise technology community gathers for the ET Enterprise AI Agentic Summit 2026, focusing on moving AI from experimentation to operational business impact with discussions on autonomous workflows, governance frameworks, and agentic systems that reason and act at scale.

items.title: Microsoft Warns of AI Memory Poisoning Attacks Surge
items.summary: Microsoft security researchers have detected a surge in 'AI Recommendation Poisoning' attacks where malicious actors inject unauthorized instructions into AI model memory, potentially compromising trust in AI services through invisible and persistent manipulation of AI responses.

items.title: University of Bayreuth Develops AI Method to Accelerate Liquid Simulations
items.summary: Researchers have created an AI approach that significantly speeds up liquid property calculations by learning universal density functionals rather than direct prediction, combining machine learning with fundamental physics principles to enable faster thermodynamic simulations.

items.title: Taiwan's AI-Powered Economy Continues Strong Growth Despite Bubble Concerns
items.summary: Taiwan's benchmark Taiex index has climbed nearly 250% over the past decade driven by AI demand, with key suppliers like Asia Vital Components reporting no signs of slowdown and already designing thermal solutions for 2028 AI servers.

items.title: AI Could Help Rebalance Power in Consumer-Service Relationships
items.summary: Artificial intelligence has potential to help people who feel overwhelmed or disadvantaged when dealing with everyday tasks like paying energy bills, offering a way to rebalance power dynamics in consumer interactions.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: DRAGON QUEST VII Reimagined and PGA TOUR 2K25 Now Available on Nintendo Switch 2
items.summary: DRAGON QUEST VII Reimagined launches today with updated visuals and gameplay for Nintendo Switch 2 and Switch, while PGA TOUR 2K25 debuts featuring major championships like The PGA Championship.

items.title: Mario Tennis Fever and Yakuza Kiwami 3 Launch Today on Nintendo Switch 2
items.summary: Nintendo Switch 2 sees releases of Mario Tennis Fever and Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties today, alongside upcoming titles like Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition on Feb. 24 and Resident Evil Requiem on Feb. 27.

items.title: 1200 Ubisoft Workers Strike Over Restructuring
items.summary: Around 1200 Ubisoft employees, primarily in France and Milan, are striking from February 10 to 12 in response to recent company restructuring efforts.

items.title: PS Plus Extra February 2026 Lineup Leaked Ahead of State of Play
items.summary: The full lineup for PS Plus Extra and Premium games in February 2026 has leaked, with a major PS5 exclusive expected to be revealed at Sony's State of Play on February 11.

items.title: Supermassive Games Announces Directive 8020 Release for May
items.summary: Supermassive's sci-fi horror game Directive 8020 is set to launch in May, featuring intense scream-filled gameplay in a space setting.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Apple Releases iOS 26.3 with Android Data-Transfer Tool
items.summary: Apple launched iOS 26.3, iPadOS 26.3, macOS Tahoe 26.3, and watchOS 26.3, primarily for bug fixes and security patches addressing 37 issues. A new tool enables transferring photos, notes, messages, and apps from Apple devices to Android, excluding health data.

items.title: ULA's Vulcan Rocket Faces Major Test with Space Force Launch
items.summary: United Launch Alliance's Vulcan rocket is set for its biggest test, carrying the heaviest payload on its longest mission for the U.S. Space Force from Cape Canaveral. Executives project 18-22 launches in 2026.

items.title: Lenovo Reports Record Q3 Revenues and CES Product Launches
items.summary: Lenovo achieved record revenues and profitability in Q3 FY 2025/26, announcing at CES devices like Lenovo Aura Edition PCs, ThinkBook Plus Gen 7, Legion Go on SteamOS, and Motorola foldables. Neptune liquid-cooling revenue grew 300% year-on-year.

items.title: Fujitsu Begins Manufacturing Sovereign Servers in Japan
items.summary: Fujitsu announced production of 'Made in Japan' sovereign AI servers with NVIDIA GPUs starting March 2026 at Kasashima Plant, plus servers with FUJITSU-MONAKA processors for enhanced security and digital sovereignty.

items.title: Blizzard Adds Warlock Class to Diablo Games in New Expansion
items.summary: Blizzard introduced the Warlock class to Diablo IV, Diablo II: Resurrected, and Diablo Immortal as part of the Lord of Hatred expansion.
